params.basePrice: The base price for the new config (in wei)
params.creationCost: The ETH cost to create a market with this config
params.liquidity: The LMSR liquidity parameter for the new config

returns._0: The index of the newly added config

buyVotes(uint256,bool,uint256,uint256).details: Protocol fees and donations are taken from the payment amount.      Excess ETH is refunded to the buyer.

params.isPositive: True to buy trust votes, false to buy distrust votes
params.maxVotesToBuy: Maximum number of votes to buy with the provided ETH
params.minVotesToBuy: Minimum acceptable number of votes (protects against slippage)
params.profileId: The ID of the market to buy votes in

constructor.details: Constructor that disables initializers when the implementation contract is deployed. This prevents the implementation contract from being initialized, which is important for security since the implementation contract should never be used directly, only through delegatecall from the proxy.

createMarket().details: This is a convenience function that calls createMarketWithConfig with index 0

createMarketWithConfig(uint256).details: Only callable by users for their own profiles when allowed; see createMarketWithConfigAdmin for creating markets on behalf of others

params.marketConfigIndex: The index of the market configuration to use

createMarketWithConfigAdmin(address,uint.details: Only callable by admins, can create markets for any address/profile

params.marketConfigIndex: The index of the market configuration to use
params.marketOwner: Create this market on behalf of this owner; will look up their profile and send donations

params.profileId: The profile ID of the market to query

returns._0: MarketInfo struct with trust/distrust votes, base price, and liquidity parameter
The number of configurations in marketConfigs array

params.profileId: The profile ID of the market

returns._0: The number of historical participants (includes addresses that sold all votes)

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

getRoleMembers(bytes32).details: Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block.

params.profileId: The profile ID of the market
params.user: The address of the user to query

returns._0: MarketInfo struct with the user's vote counts and market parameters

params.isPositive: Whether to get trust (true) or distrust (false) odds
params.profileId: The profile ID of the market

returns._0: The odds converted to a price in wei (odds * basePrice)

graduateMarket(uint256).details: Only callable by the authorized Ethos graduation contract

params.profileId: The ID of the market to graduate

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

isAllowedToCreateMarket(uint256).details: Checks if the user is allowed to create a market.

params.profileId: The profileId of the user to check.

returns._0: True if the profile is allowed to create a market, false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

removeMarketConfig(uint256).details: Removes a market configuration option while maintaining at least one config

params.configIndex: The index of the config to remove

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

sellVotes(uint256,bool,uint256,uint256).details: Protocol fees are taken from the sale proceeds.      Proceeds are sent to the seller after fees.

params.isPositive: True to sell trust votes, false to sell distrust votes
params.minimumVotePrice: Minimum acceptable price per vote (protects against slippage)
params.profileId: The ID of the market to sell votes in

setAllowListEnforcement(bool).details: Controls whether the allow list is enforced for market creation

params.value: true to enforce allow list (only allowed profiles can create markets),              false to allow anyone to create a market for their own profile

params.basisPoints: The new donation percentage in basis points, maximum 500 (5%)

setEntryProtocolFeeBasisPoints(uint256).details: Sets the protocol fee in basis points

params.basisPoints: The new fee in basis points, maximum 500 (5%)
The new fee in basis points, maximum 500 (5%)

params.newProtocolFeeAddress: The address to receive protocol fees

params.profileId: The profile ID to modify permissions for
params.value: True to allow market creation, false to disallow

params.isPositive: True for trust votes, false for distrust votes
params.profileId: The profile ID of the market
params.votesToBuy: Number of votes to simulate buying

returns.purchaseCostBeforeFees: The base cost of votes before fees

params.isPositive: True for trust votes, false for distrust votes
params.profileId: The profile ID of the market
params.votesToSell: Number of votes to simulate selling

targetExistsAndAllowedForId(uint256).details: Checks whether market exists and is allowed to be used for replies and upvotes

returns.allowed: Whether market is allowed to be used

updateDonationRecipient(uint256,address).details: Only callable by current recipient. New recipient must have same profileId.      Transfers any existing donation balance to the new recipient.

params.newRecipient: The new address to receive donations
params.profileId: The profile ID of the market to update

params.owner: Owner address to be used instead of current.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

withdrawDonations().details: Transfers all donations from escrow to the caller

withdrawGraduatedMarketFunds(uint256).details: Only callable by the authorized Ethos graduation contract

params.profileId: The ID of the graduated market to withdraw from

addMarketConfig(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Adds a new market configuration option

buyVotes(uint256,bool,uint256,uint256).notice: Buy trust or distrust votes for a marketpayable - Send ETH to cover vote cost plus fees

createMarket().notice: Creates a new reputation market for a profile using the default market configuration

createMarketWithConfig(uint256).notice: Creates a new reputation market for a profile using a specific market configuration

createMarketWithConfigAdmin(address,uint.notice: Creates a new reputation market for a profile using a specific market configuration

getMarket(uint256).notice: Gets the current vote counts, prices, and parameters for a market

getMarketConfigCount().notice: Gets the number of available market configurations

getParticipantCount(uint256).notice: Gets the total number of addresses that have ever held votes in a market

getUserVotes(address,uint256).notice: Gets the number of trust and distrust votes owned by a user in a market

getVotePrice(uint256,bool).notice: Calculates the current odds for a market position and converts them to a price using the market's base price

graduateMarket(uint256).notice: Graduates a market, marking it as inactive for trading

sellVotes(uint256,bool,uint256,uint256).notice: Sell trust or distrust votes from a market

setDonationBasisPoints(uint256).notice: Sets the donation percentage in basis points

setExitProtocolFeeBasisPoints(uint256).notice: Sets the exit protocol fee in basis points

setProtocolFeeAddress(address).notice: Sets the address that receives protocol fees

setUserAllowedToCreateMarket(uint256,boo.notice: Sets whether a specific profile is allowed to create a market

simulateBuy(uint256,bool,uint256).notice: Simulates buying votes to preview costs and fees without executing the trade

simulateSell(uint256,bool,uint256).notice: Simulates selling votes to preview proceeds and fees without executing the trade

updateDonationRecipient(uint256,address).notice: Updates the donation recipient for a market

withdrawDonations().notice: Allows a market owner to withdraw their accumulated donations

withdrawGraduatedMarketFunds(uint256).notice: Withdraws all funds from a graduated market
